Title: Cellular Division - Part 2
Content: Meiosis is a special type of cell division that reduces the number of chromosomes by half. Four haploid cells known as sex cells are created during this process. Meiosis occurs in all sexually reproducing organisms including animals, plants, and fungi. Sex cells are produced for the purpose of creating new offspring. Not all organisms reproduce sexually, but those that do experience increased genetic diversity in their populations.
